discussion.content: The right answer id D not A

questions.question_text: Which is true about interactive reports?

choices.A: Interactive reports can be either read-only or editable.
choices.C: You can define only one interactive report on a page.
choices.B: All columns defined in the report query must be shown.
choices.D: An interactive report can be based on a PL/SQL function body returning a SQL query.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think A is the correct answer too, but I'm not 100% sure.
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/apex/23.1/htmdb/preventing-url-tampering.html#GUID-AF34B5A4-5BA1-4FD7-A706-664E277ADC09:~:text=throughout%20the%20application.-,Page%20Access%20Protection,-%3A
imho it should be sufficient to update Page Access Protection to 'Arguments Must Have Checksum' => A

choices.E: Update Page Access Protection to No URL Access
choices.A: Update Page Access Protection to Arguments Must Have Checksum

questions.question_text:
Sunny has developed a report and form on CUSTOMERS, which is open to partners. The report displays only customers associated with partners, based on their user credentials. Partners can click an Edit button to go to a form page to update their customers. Sunny is concerned that IT savvy users will be able to alter the
URL to be able to see and update records from other partners.
What must Sunny do to protect the form page from URL tampering?

choices.B: Define a report query and report layout based on the EMP table. Add a button to the page to output the report.
choices.C: Update the Interactive Report attributes and set Download > PDF to "Checked".
choices.D: Update the Interactive Report attributes and set Download > High Fidelity to "Checked".
choices.A: Create a modal page with a classic report on EMP by using the Printer-Friendly template. Add a button to the page to call the new modal page.

questions.question_text:
Bob has created an interactive report on the EMP table. Oracle BI Publisher has been configured as the report server in his environment. He has been asked to output a high-fidelity PDF report, which lists all employees.
How can Bob define the report?

choices.C: Set Debug Level to 9 and review the debug messages.

questions.question_text:
Nancy has an application that is performing unexpectedly. She has turned on debug for the page and reviewed the debug messages and still can't determine the cause of the inconsistent behavior. She believes it may be an APEX bug.
What action should Nancy take to identify the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDFG
BDFG are correct, 100%. Not sure if now (v23.1) it is possible A.

questions.question_text: Which four tasks can you perform using the Shared Components section in Application Builder? (Choose four.)

choices.F: Change navigational components of the application
choices.B: Manage translatable text messages for the application
choices.A: Edit the No Data Found messages for multiple report regions in the application
choices.C: Review debug messages generated by the application
choices.G: Add different application roles and configure their role assignment
